bibl.title: Letter from Caroline Latimer to Howard A. Kelly, June 18, [1908]

div1.p: Latimer agrees that Kelly and herself should stop supporting the Kissingers, but she still wants to find alternative sources of income for them.

div1.head: Letter from Caroline Latimer to Howard A. Kelly, June 18, [1908]
div1.opener:
K
Try to do this
1408 ??? Park Ave
June 18
Dear Dr, Kelly:
div1.p:
I am sorry you
misunderstood me about
the Kissingers. I did not
for a moment imagine
you were suggesting I
should contribute to their
assistance, but I was
afraid that you might
think I had neglected
to send Mrs Kissinger
the help for her clothing
which I had told
you some weeks ago
that I would do.
Therfore I called your
Ac
Ki
attention to the fact that
the letter you sent was
an old one.

I am only too anxious
to help the Kissinger and
if the Carnagie plan does
not succeed, I hope you
will let me know, for
I have another scheme in
mind. If I can be of
any assistance at present
please call on me.

I send you a note
just received from Mrs
Kissinger,. I have written
explaining how busy you
are,
div1.closer:
Yours very sincerely Caroline Latimer over
The package Mrs K. speaks of was
a small matter. I had already sent
her what covered actual necessaries.
